summary: Diff updates Phase10ScoreEntry to initialize phase-complete state to false for new rounds and snapshots completion state at submit time, but evidence is insufficient/absent for the required visual checkbox behavior and for ensuring phase progression is applied only when completed=true across both saved and quick sessions. The code also retains an optional one-way (non-uncheckable) checkbox mode that can conflict with the requested free toggling behavior.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure the Phase 10 phase-complete checkbox visually behaves like a standard checkbox: the checkmark is visible only when checked and not visible when unchecked; no custom styling causes the check indicator to remain visible when unchecked.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff snippet does not show the actual Checkbox rendering props/styling (truncated after computing isChecked). There is no evidence in the provided diff summary that the visual checkmark issue was addressed.

missing_requirements.requirement: During Phase 10 score submission, only record/log phase completion if checked at submission time; for saved sessions backend submission must not increment/update progress where completed=false; for quick sessions local phase10Progress must not increment for completed=false.
missing_requirements.reason: Frontend now snapshots `phaseCompletions` into `entryState` at submission time, but the diff provides no evidence that saved-session submission payload handling/backend update logic filters out completed=false, nor that quick-session local phase10Progress update logic ignores false completions. No backend files were modified in this diff summary.

hallucinated_features.description: Optional one-way (non-uncheckable) phase-complete checkbox behavior via `oneWayCheckbox` prop that prevents unchecking once checked.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest requires free toggling (check and uncheck) before submission; adding/retaining a mode that blocks unchecking is not requested and can directly violate REQ-1 depending on how it is used.

hallucinated_features.description: Clamping Phase 10 progress/current phase values to the 1â€“10 range when reading session state.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by the BuildRequest (which explicitly calls out not changing Phase 10 sorting/standings logic and focuses only on checkbox submission behavior). This may be benign, but it is an unrequested behavioral change shown in the diff.
